events.message: The customer reported their car was involved in a collision with another vehicle at an intersection yesterday afternoon.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and the type of damage described.
An agent was assigned to the claim to assist the customer through the process and answer any immediate questions.
The insurance company acknowledged the receipt of the claim and confirmed the initiation of the review process.
Further documents were requested including photos of the damaged vehicle and a police accident report for assessment.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed images of the collision damage.
Investigation into the details of the car accident was initiated to verify the claimâ€™s accuracy and coverage details.
The investigation concluded confirming the collision circumstances matched those reported by the policyholder.
A settlement amount based on repair estimates and policy limits was proposed to the claimant for approval.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claims process.
Following customer approval, the claim was formally approved for payment issuing without further delay.
An electronic payment was issued to cover the vehicle repairs as per the approved settlement agreement.
The claim was officially closed after confirming the payment was received and repair work was scheduled.
All documents and claim records were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance purposes.
